sentence: we tried the baked, beer-battered, and fried fish
we ordered a kalamari appetizer to share, three beer battered cod fish fry dinners and one breaded shrimp dinner
finally she came with our entrees but still no beer we had ordered to go with our meals
good place for a beer as well
the place is full of regulars drinking cheap beer
there were a bunch of locals there having a good time and if we were there with a group of our friends it might be ok for a few beers
if i ever went back it would be for a few beers and the view, that's it
they specialize in cheap beer and great food

notice that i am not saying much about the food? here's the deal:
- it was friday
- it was hot
- the beer was cold
- the fish fry was exactly what you would expect in a place like this: great walleye!

'nough said

(another caveat: there are maybe six restaurants in mcfarland that don't have drive-thrus)  

i ordered the walleye and eggs both times along with a bloody mary (gotta love a beer back, yay for wisconsin)
too bad because the beer was nice and cold
everything was served together in a box; everything you need except several icy cold beers

+ huge establishment - impressively big
+ quick to be seated
+ server was friendly
+ waters were refilled quickly
+ decent selection of bottled beers/drinks

- massive menu, but not really
after a wonderful day spent sitting down at the memorial union, drinking beer and reading through the sunday newspaper, hunger got the better part of us, and mexican food sounded yummy
only complaints?  a tad pricey - our meal was $26 without any beers/margaritas, and there were a ton of kids in there, which was a bit distracting
on certain weeknights they serve free beer
free beer
the social offers a free meal and drinks (including beer and wine) for a couple hours in the evening
big tables to study at or meet friends, great selection of wine and beer, free internet access and busy enough to not feel strange but slow enough that you can almost always get a seat
i love the concept of a coffee shop/wine & beer store in one
i am a beer snob and proud of it, so when the only local tap option is spotted cow i call foul
what really seals it for me is sometimes the spotted lines aren't even clean and the beer comes out flat and a bit funky

it allows for many interesting interactions making an evening here very fun!!
 
agreed with other reviews the beer selection is limited but they do have a descent array of hard liquors especially my personal favorite whiskey!! the prices from my one time stop seemed reasonable and the drinks actually had some liquor in them instead of just soda or water
the bar is usually not packed they have a decent selection of tap beers and almost always have decent drink specials
darts, pool, tuesday blues night (live blues band!), fun times, decent beer, waffle fries, and fried cheese curds (if you don't mind the sort that come from the freezer)
waited 10-15 minutes for a beer and then was advised only 'select' apps were half price [2-3 of 16 on menu]?! hmmm
, the beer was not very cold but the prices were ok for the area
only two beers on tap, but both good local brews from capital
i ordered the blackened catfish and a beer
the bar had a good selection of local wisconsin beers as well as your typical domestics
a nice (unassuming) place to throw a few bowling balls and drink beers with your friends

it's not the embodiment of the latest in bowling technology, but who cares? the food is greasy, the beer is cold, and it's your turn -- let's see what ya got!

also, the fact that this is the only alley in town that has helped me procure balls for mondo croquet (http://twurl
if you enjoy playing ball, having a cold beer, and having fun with some friends - this is a good place for a league
the fish itself had a flavorful beer batter that was a little thicker than what you'll typically find at most places, but it was delicious and i welcomed the extra crunch
this is the place to go for a cold beer after a softball game
after downing a second round of beers (cows all around this time), it dawned on us that we probably needed to inquire about a table
good greasy hushpuppies and cold beer
nice divey spot for a beer
they make good drinks and have a small but respectable selection of draft beers that meet the needs of both craft beer lovers and miller lite-types
bar tenders were friendly and the beer (limited) was cheap
want a burger?  go here!  price is a little on the high side for some of their dishes, but if your looking for a casual place to grab a beer and burger, this is the place
go for the specials, burgers, beer or the burrito!
their tap beer selection was good and its obvious they do a lot of business
excellent friday fish fry!  their beer batter fish is crisp,tasty, and not at all greasy
enjoy the friday fish fry and yes, an ice cold beer
i am looking forward to next friday already!   i forgot to mention that they have a decent selection of on tap beer
nice to go for your birthday mug with unlimited beer/soda and the world's smallest ice cream sundae
23 bucks for one gritty burger, one small cheese curd order and two draft beers
the only time you should really go is if it's your birthday so you can have free beer
you get your glass mug filled with beer, soda, or juice with unlimited refills, while also getting a very small ice cream sundae at the end
unfortunately, the beer isn't cheap, nor were there other obvious specials
out of sirloin and a certain beer

finally get the all you can eat fish which had 2 pieces of pollock, beer battered fries, tartar, and coleslaw:
fish: ok sized
monday night taco nights are pretty awesome, the tacos aren't anything fancy, but they're cheap, and help to offset the copious amounts of tap beer i tend to imbibe
(note: if you drink it straight from the pitcher, it still counts as one beer) club tavern also offers a pretty good breakfast, and they have specials for the early birds
not the world's greatest beer, but definitely affordable during happy hour
the brewery has a nice little bar inside and, in the summers, a beer garden outside
the brewery also has something else inside: lots of really, really good beer
you do not get a beer to start off, which sucks
after the tour, (weather permitting, i assume) you go outside to the beer garden to get your 2oz
the guide has to go around and fill up everyone on the tour (~50 people) before you get your beers, so budget an extra hour to sample
samples and a tiny beer shot glass for $2
not a bad deal; they just need to make the beers at the bar cheaper so you can leave with a smile on your face
fun little brewery, good little tour, and you wouldn't believe how  nicely you can get  a jump start on your buzz just by drinking constantly from the little beer mug shot glass  of samples
the brewery makes several excellent beers (they were rated as the #1 brewery in the us by someone, sometime)
my parents live very close to the brewery/beer garden and it is so much fun to hang out there in the summer
i wish this beer garden was located in warmer weather so i could enjoy it all year long!
the beer garden rules
it goes without saying that they've got great beer
and while it's pretty easy to find capital beers on tap or at stores throughout the area, nothing beats fresh from the brewery
as an added bonus, you can often get the seasonals or other less prominent beers on tap here as opposed to the bottles prevalent elsewhere
there's even a few wine choices for the non-beer drinking crowd, including wollersheim's prairie fume
it beats the regular 16 oz plastic cups and i'd hazard a guess it's comparable to getting a pitcher, without the necessity of coming to agreement on what beer to order
) this was my favorite tour because the guides actually describe the process of making beer and tastings were handed out rather copiously
started with a beer in a pint glass in the bar (you getto keep the glass)
the tour guide was very casual and provided good info about the beer and brewing process
at various points along the way a woman would show up with pitchers of different types of beer and pour it in your glass if you wanted a taste
the beer was very fresh and it all tatsted good
i've been drinking their beer for a few years but was only able to make the trip up to middleton to take the tour yesterday
we had 4 beers on the tour- island wheat, supper club, maibock and amber
outside beer garden was great and the indoor bar was small but accommodating
i don't find my way out in these parts often but we had a great time and some fantastic beers
started off with a free beer, had the octoberfest
very good beer
answered some questions we had about beer also
the beer garden (bier garten?) is huge, filled with weather-beaten picnic tables, and covered with a big awning to keep out the sun
people bring their kids, their dogs, decks of cards and board games, and enjoy the excellent beer that's doled out at the outdoor taps by friendly staff
good beer
fun atmosphere at outdoor beer garden
during the spring/summer/fall months, their beer garden is phenomenal
stop by on a saturday or sunday and take the tour (it's only a couple of dollars, includes samples, and runs hourly), then spend time enjoying some of capital's great beers
autumnal fire was great, not exactly my kind of beer, but still tasty
would try more beers definitely
such was the case with me stumbling upon capital brewery in madison, wisconsin - a festive,  local beer haven surrounded by sprawling suburban retail strip malls and chain restaurants

i only had an hour to kill before a wedding, but that hour was filled with bonfires, live music,  locally crafted dopplebock and conversations with the most knowledgeable beer lovers i've ever met (they know the brooklyn brewery folks on a first name basis)
our tour guide was very lively and fun, and knew a looooooot about the process of brewing beer
we also got a small drinking glass as part of our tour, and 3 beer bottle caps that can be traded in for a sample of anything on tap
you can also trade in all 3 caps for a pint of a single beer, which i wish i had known about before i eagerly sampled my first beer
anywaaays, the tour was short and sweet, and the beer cold and refreshing
the beer garden aspect is tempting for a possible future return, but we'll see
cool place- nice outside bier garden, live music, tons of craft beers

)
nothing beats a brew in one of madison's best beer gardens
they have a good selection of beer and a giant outdoor bar area
their beers are decent, not the best in town, though
as far as beer is concerned, there's much better out there in madison
beer i great though
pretty reasonable prices too if you want beers/pitchers also (which you will)
the beer are all good with my favorites being the maibock and autumnal fire (eisphyre) if it is available
for those that prefer lighter beers the amber or supper club are wonderful too
the beer garden is a great place to enjoy a cold brew, sunshine and live music in the summer time
the staff is awesome and the beer is delicious

8
short description:  brewery
pluses:  good beer, interesting building
negatives: not the best price, not the best service, need a better menu overall
recommendations:  decent enough if you like their beer styles
i previously tried some of their beers at the mke brewfest and was semi-impressed by the new imperial ipas so i wanted to give some of their other beers a try
i don't know if it's because we came on a day where there was a 5k or what, but the brewery was pretty much closed except for the beer garden and the little store inside
i totally committed alcohol abuse and threw half of my beer away
i really enjoy the beer garden
i tried all the beers (13 total) and only two really stood out, the others were eh
5 and based upon the beers sampled
if i could bring my own beer to the garden, it would be awesome
we keep coming here and having a great time!  always great beer and good live music
not only was the manager a complete jerk the whole day, the beer cart girl was lazy and snotty
beers/wine also seems to be reasonable
in addition, there were the usual wisconsin knick knacks, including many types of beers, wines, and other kitsch-y stuff like ashtrays and bottle openers
the mousehouse offers some great wi items--cheese, beer, wine and cute gifts
wisconsin cheese, wine & beer
but it is truly a wonderful world of cheese, fudge,  great wine end beer selections
i like that this place has a big selection of craft beers
they had specialty gifts, wine, beer and fudge amongst a haven of cheese
they were happy to give advice about what beer we would like and happily cut samples of cheese
although we only left with a 6 pack of wisconsin only beer for $9
i'd say about 70% of the store is "not cheese" meaning t-shirts, souvenirs, fudge, beer, wine, jellies and the like
you'll like this place a lot more if you're from out of state and don't have a ready source for delicious wi cheese and tasty new glarus beer
heck, even if you don't, there's still plenty of other stuff to look at (beef jerkey, beer/wine, fudge, etc
it's just that there are so many places with better beer, nicer bartenders, friendlier crowds and better food
they have a terrible beer selection and the majority of their patrons are complete douchebags (read: fat, shirtless guys and snooki wannabes)
in fact, i am not sure it is possible to receive $14 in savings given the limitations of the sandwich menu and domestic beer selections
to be clear, we also ordered an appetizer, soft drink, and craft beer
they have frozen drinks, on the rocks drinks, beer, liquor, you name they have it
nice beer selection featuring many wisconsin labels
the food was merely average and the "specially brewed" beer was weak
they had this cool 4' tower of beer that looked kind of fun to drink from
however, i was surprised by the reasonable beer selection and the nice menu
promptly seated, very attentive staff, nice but simple drink, beer, and wine list
the beers are cheap and the service is above average
last time we ate there we spent less than forty bucks for two people with beers and tip
want a burger and a beer? you can do much worse than wilsons
we ordered a couple of beers and they were prompt but not really cold
their beer selection is good for wi beers and not as expensive as other places
it's a great place to see a band, and they have good beers on tap too
excellent selection of local beers on tap, friendly staff
i like the little plastic cups your beer comes in
the tap beer selection is good, but that's pretty standard in this town
bottled beer selection pales in comparison to other venues, and the liquor and wine options are slim pickings
did i mention they have tap beer??  not just crappy tap beer, but 8 different craft beers

celebrate father's day with
the rousers
sunday june 15th
83rd annual cottage grove fireman's festival
cottage grove, wi
2-5 pm in the big beer tent
admission is free
cheese for happy-hour-nacho-and-beer-aficionados
crack open another beer and wait and chug and wait and chug and wait
if you like tap beer the selection is limited, but very inexpensive, and the lines are always clean (hint: the owner drinks tap beer)
we recently visited them and found the fish (baked cod, beer battered cod) to be excellent
as we lined up at the bar to order beers and grub -- the bartender's muttering under her breath "oh shit
the beer battered cod is really good, so are the waffle fries, and the beer guy/owner(?) is definitely uber passionate about what he has on tap
quick review: if it weren't for the stellar fish fry and the awesome beer selection, this place would be a solid 2
alas, the fish is unreal and the beer selection rivals many (if not most) of madison's finest
the waiter came back to take our dinner order: two orders of beer battered cod, an order of lake perch, and an order of shrimp

the only benefit to being forgotten was that we had plenty of time to read the beer menu, which features a nice selection of craft beers from microbreweries - dexter's doesn't strike me as a place that would feature such a wide selection of unique beers, but i guess it goes to prove that you can never judge a book by its cover

5 stars (excellent fish; curds and fries were stellar)
service = 2 stars (they forgot about us, but made up for it)
value = 2 stars (would've been over $85 for the 4 of us)
misc = 3 stars (the place isn't much to look at, but has an excellent beer selection
a pub serving lagunitas' beer on the tap gets an automatic 4 stars in my book keeping
i shall be back there to sample more beer and heckle at olympic games on a tv screen
unexpectedly diverse beer selection that's constantly rotating (had a great lagunita's hairy eyeball)
i personally wish that they had some more local stuff on the beer menu, but aside from that, i can't really complain about the selection
for dinner, i ordered beer battered cod with carrot soup, and my boyfriend ordered a burger with chili garlic fries
i'm from out of town and was looking for a place to have some beer and some good food and this place was excellent
the beer selection was great and we got a pitcher of a microbrew for $10, which i thought was a great price
excellent tap-beer selection with many microbrews
the beer selection is wide and diverse, with an emphasis on wisconsin brews
they have a great selection of beer and pour a great drink too!  the wait staff is fantastic as well, extremely friendly and hard working
went for the bell's tap take-over for mad-craft-beer-week
there's the obviously excellent beer selection - it's constantly rotating, and it always tastes fresh and wonderful
the staff really know their beer - if you ever have a question, don't hesitate to ask because they will offer a sample, suggestions, and plenty of information

key points:
 - waitress was great, offered tastes of beer to help my decision
 - perch and cod, both good and plenty of it
 - pub fries were great, not overcooked like so may places
 - echoing other compliments on the beer selection, nice
 - fine for the kids too, at least earlier around dinner time (5-7)

i'd come back to try non-fish fry some night
great beers on tap
i've been to dexters a couple times now and am in love with one thing about it; the beer selection
the waiting isn't too bad as i said before, their beer offerings are pretty boss
the last time i went in for food and a beer it was lovely
decent beer selection most of the time
the beer selection is both expansive and fresh (they open new taps frequently), and the food is excellent bar-food fare with some healthy salad-type options

**don't pass up the garlic chile fries!**

i love the tap beer selection and all of the entrees we've tried have been great!
great beer choices that change frequently and we were pleasantly surprised by their sandwiches as well
it will also appeal to people who want an unassuming space to quaff some delicious craft beer
beer -  fantastic
they have rotating taps of featured beer
their bartenders are usually knowledgeable about the beer, and they know how to pour a hefeweizen correctly
good beer selection, which always rotates
now, the beer list is exquisite in my opinion
from toppling goliath (which i love, but you can't really get outside of iowa and wisco) to belgian flander's reds, they kill it with their beer selection
also, i really respect that they let you know on the beer list what's on deck
there is plenty of room to wait and have a beer from the huge selection they have
we had waffle fries, potato chips and the pub fries, which are beer pattered
" the beer selection is wonderful, bartenders and staff are knowledgeable and attentive, and the food is well above typical bar food standards
if you're going for the beer, you won't be disappointed
they have a great tap beer selection (lots of micro brews)
the food is great and the craft beers are even better
the craft beer selection is solid and changes often
i don't live quiiiiite close enough for this to be my neighborhood bar, but it meets all the requirements: laid-back atmosphere, great food, and seriouslygreatcraftbeerlist
their beers are all of the cant-pick-up-at-the-gas-station variety and it's worth coming by just for that--the menu diversity is the cherry on top of my craft beer float
the beer menu is ridiculously long
service was fast and we had two great beers and our soup before we knew it
one of the best beer lists in town too! great homemade chips and french onion dip and a locally made pretzel with great dips came next
as a non beer lover (i know, i know), i wasn't expecting to fall in love with dexter's
they have plenty of beer on tap, and plenty of televisions for your viewing pleasure
their beer selection is amazing
i tried 3 different new-to-me beers and there were still a bunch more i wanted to taste
we went to dexter's on friday for the fish fry at the start craft beer week
but that didn't matter because we got to have a couple of tasty beers
it's a great mix of people who are friendly and there to enjoy the beer/food
dexter's is a nice neighborhood bar with good beer selection, and great drink specials

:-)

i'm fairly new to the world of craft beers, but i'm a big fan of the beer list here

+ one of the best craft beer lists in all of madison; changes daily
+ host tons of beer-related events and tap-takeovers
+ even when swamped, you can usually find a seat at the bar or at a high-top
+ service is quite prompt and thorough, but as noted, not super personable/friendly 

+ hopalicious hummus remains one of my favorite plates in the area
- not a huge fan of the pizzas; i've tried several and they're not all that awesome
they have a nice beer selection in the bar and cute waitresses
very nice, clean, great bar area with unique beer on tap (hello three floyd's!) comfortable room, love the relaxation toiletries and the bed was great!
to top things off - while they don't have a bar, you can buy bottles of beers for 2 to 2
so - despite cheap beer, free popcorn and fast wifi - they lost the star for the abysmal 'gym'
i have two rules:  i want to shop in my neighborhood--preferably locally owned, and i want to be able to do 90% of my food/beer buying in one place
a walk-in beer cooler, complete with jackets for comfort? oh yeah
great produce, superb butcher counter, lots of wine, tons of beer
surprisingly good selection of produce, ice cream, wine and beer
the selections here are good, the meats aren't bad (though they have far fewer local selections than they should), and the beer corner is just awesome
seriously, the beer corner is the best part of this store
the meat, beer and wine selections are good
the market has an excellent wine, beer and cheese selection
beer, cheese, deli meat, prime cuts, and produce), but this is also a bit of the weakness, no? if i got full on grocery shopping to do, i'll go to hy-vee

come here to wear the big jackets and dance in the beer room! 

the deli is good, the produce is great, decent selection of all things i eat
i bought a giant spaghetti squash for $1!!! they have a great selection of wine and beer and a lot of basic items that other small markets lack (or charge an arm and a leg for)
you'll be hard-pressed to find better quality produce or meat in the area, and their beer cooler is one of the best in terms of variety and options
having said that i only ever buy meats, produce and beer there
compared to woodman's the beer is probably 10% more expensive but they have a better selection in their 500 sq ft cooler than the entire woodman's liquor store
truly a craft beer paradise

the butcher counter is astounding for a neighborhood grocery, but perhaps more 
impressive is the craft beer selection
beer selection, meat market and convenience surpassed only by friendly and helpful staff
i find the staff to be helpful, the meat counter excellent, cheese selection fantastic and the beer cooler beyond compare
we got our name down for a lane, and waited in the bar, where they have at least 10 beers on tap, a couple of them local brews
lots of different tap beers,pool tables,darts,golden tee, etc
i'd have a beer and bowl a round there any day
it was delicious! i love that this place serves sprecher root beer
so many great-looking options for veg-heads like myself, hallelujah a-men, and they even have a small wine list and beer
breakfast all day, more than just burgers and fries, deserts, beer selection
alcohol is offered, wine and beer galore
they also serve alcohol (bottled beer and spirits only)
this is a great example of a typical 'local color' wisconsin tavern/grill ! friday fish,reasonable beer/drink prices,and outstanding service
owner chico is really nice, and we love that he's going out of his way to buy local ingredients and beer
low key, no frills, tasty food and a wide variety of beers
about $60 for two burgers, eleven beers and a shot
the craft beer selection is impressive
the beer taps have a nice selection, the price is lower than the more trendy bars of the area
we each ordered a beer on tap from the nice, older lady who was bartending, (pbr and leinie's, if i remember correctly) and paid something like $3 total
as we drank our beers, we decided to arm wrestle
exactly the type of bar i want to sit and have a beer and make friends with at
a crap beer (miller brands) in a plastic bottle runs another $6

at the warm warner park, i was able to get a seat right behind the dugout (word is that they are county stadium relics) for $10! they offer 18 different beers including incredible microbrews collectible plastic cups for $3
50 or less! besides great beer, there were funnel cakes, turkey legs, burgers, brats and much more
the food is pretty decent but the real attraction is the beer
led by local brewpub great dane's signature mallards ale, there is an excellent selection of beer
duck blind tickets cost something like $30 for all the beer and food you can put down during the game

if you can't watch the game, why the hell are you paying $30 for beer and hot dogs?

but i digress
i like the "two beers, two hotdogs and a ticket" one
the duckblind is the place to go if you're looking to eat and drink a lot! it's all you can eat and drink beer (or soda)
and, they actually have good beers, not just the cheap stuff
great beer options, all $3
food and beer are top-notch in both prices and quality
the beer selection is great

some friends and i went ahead and paid the $28 for unlimited great dane beer (fat tire, magic hat, ranger ipa, great dane brews abound), unlimited noms (brats, pulled pork, even boca burgers for, ahem, those inclined) and field-side seating
all-you-can-eat ballpark food (which is perfectly adequate ballpark food, nothing to rave about) and all-you-can-drink adult beverages (from a fairly extensive beer list)? challenge accepted
drink options are superb - tons of craft beers to enjoy, many from the great dane
i will say the beer options are nothing short of amazing

of course, the beer is pretty good - lots of craft options!  if you're not going to drink beer, sign up for the designated driver list and get a wristband for free soda and a chance to win a jersey!

baseball:  entertaining
the "beer batter" is always fun (a certain guy on the other team - if he strikes out, it's 2-1 beers for the rest of the inning)
there are over 17 different beers available plus people selling seagrams escape drinks (supposedly gluten free!), lime-a-ritas etc

the duck blind is where it's at!

for $33, you get to watch the madison mallards while you enjoy unlimited food and beer all night long in the duck blind
- the concessions were still open and serving beer and snacks
it was a simple cornbread-type breading that was good, but somewhat uninteresting - not the flamboyant texture of the beer battered fish we have grown to expect
the bill for two with a few beers and desert was just under $40
the bar was cozy, the beers fresh, and the service attentive, friendly, and helpful
beer prices are good and it's got a great homey atmosphere
best beer on tap? moose drool hands down
the tap beers are not only unexciting, they're as stale and flat as day old bread that's been run over by a steamroller

its biggest downsides:
- it's touted as a blue-collar bar, but it's more an excuse to be shabby and dirty than anything; $15 for a 5-bottle bucket of beer is not a good deal, and $5 for a pbr & a rail shot is a special for a couple hours one night a week when it should be the standard price for such a combination
- the ladies room is ridiculously tiny and awkward, had a seat that was half hanging off the bowl, and no tp
- every surface was dirty or sticky, yuck

you probably won't die if you go to see a friend's band play, but supporting a friend should be the only motivation for setting foot inside
as for the crap tap beer-order a bottle
they didn't have any drink specials, which made me sad :( i'm used to just getting whatever beer is on sale, because i like everything, but no such luck
however, they aren't expensive so i paid about 4 dollars for a beer i think
